column1: History shows us that crises create opportunities for change and the COVID-19 crisis is no different. With President-elect Biden and Vice President-elect Harris leading our country forward it's time we fight this virus head on and Build Back Better. https://t.co/5SAlMoeCx9 https://t.co/5UoiA8qG4K

The testing and administration of the COVID-19 vaccine can establish new standards of how disadvantaged communities and the health care and research communities interact and work together. We must rebuild trust. https://t.co/LSInhRSOL0 https://t.co/hpFXwCPkEQ

As we come closer to a legitimate release of a #COVID19 vaccine enormous challenges must be considered in its administration and distribution — how can officials bridge the medical research trust gap? Read my op-ed now » https://t.co/yNMm2SBGT1 https://t.co/9gQj23pOgh

I am grateful for Mayor Kenney's support to make renter and homeowner assistance a top priority in our next COVID-19 relief package.   The Making Housing Matter plan will work to deliver additional housing relief to help our communities recover. https://t.co/Hd39ILCwA5 https://t.co/naJgeGV1M0

Over a million Pennsylvanians deal with food insecurity every day — and the COVID-19 pandemic has only worsened this issue.   I'll keep fighting to protect SNAP and support initiatives that end hunger in our state and the country. #WorldFoodDay https://t.co/4c9Y5ea5JD https://t.co/gETk17BDx2

Forcing schools to reopen with in-person classes won't make the #COVID19 health crisis & financial crisis disappear. It will put children teachers and staff at risk of getting sick and passing on this deadly virus to loved ones. Sign the petition NOW » https://t.co/aCkibefZos https://t.co/Ya91IdZG75

First Trump wanted to "slow the testing down."  Now he's trying to hide our country's COVID-19 data from the people he claims to represent.   Trying to hide the pandemic won’t make it go away.  NO 👏🏿 MORE 👏🏿 CORRUPT 👏🏿 COVER-UPS 👏🏿  Learn more >> https://t.co/nRw6SCqvOZ https://t.co/kUTSNe1C2O

Misinformation about COVID-19 on Facebook Google and Twitter is dangerous to public health.   We must hold online platforms accountable and ensure they are combating false information that's a threat to the health and safety of our communities.  MORE >> https://t.co/CvQcapKXfR https://t.co/WqIHU5tWdI

FYI we are making it easier to withdraw from your retirement accounts if you need additional COVID-19 relief. The IRS has officially expanded eligibility so be sure to take advantage of this CARES Act provision if you're in need.  LEARN MORE >> https://t.co/oNJ82dt9gu https://t.co/l817q7JeFy

Pentagon officials express concern as Trump threatens to use military to 'dominate' protestors >> https://t.co/ZIhujNIS7c  Shame on you @realDonaldTrump.  We don't need more violence. We need to listen heal and focus on solutions to racial inequality and addressing COVID-19. https://t.co/wqeVFagpSL

People are fired up to take back our government in November but they also have lots of questions about voting amid COVID-19. We still need some help to turnout out voters this weekend -- can we count on you? #VoteBlue @Back2BluePA @PADems  SIGN UP NOW: https://t.co/wwVU75Bf37 https://t.co/js7u5SIxir

@politico: "Trump removes independent watchdog for coronavirus funds upending oversight panel" >> https://t.co/a7pVMrXpTF  Not even a global public health crisis can put a stop to Trump's blatant corruption. https://t.co/96mxKRZN74

Disproportionately black counties account for over half of coronavirus cases in the U.S. and nearly 60% of deaths >> https://t.co/er2v4KFJv4  WE 👏🏿 CANNOT 👏🏿 TALK 👏🏿 ABOUT 👏🏿 THIS 👏🏿 ENOUGH 👏🏿  Public health is a racial justice issue and must be treated as such. https://t.co/ium11g6kJs

Racial equity must be a priority in our COVID-19 response >> https://t.co/Hy3d23sA9V  I helped secure funds for minority-owned businesses but more transparency is needed.   I've also asked that the Black Doctors COVID-19 Consortium be included in our state's strategy. https://t.co/jwmCxMrMHI

House passes $484 billion bill with money for small businesses hospitals and testing to battle coronavirus >> https://t.co/8latl1zb2X  Yesterday I voted to support local small businesses national testing and our hospitals and frontline health care workers. https://t.co/9oKhtJ7R0Q
Coronavirus fact-checks for @realDonaldTrump >> https://t.co/HSsFW4GcAa   Facts are facts America.  Stay healthy stay informed and stay connected.
@Newsweek: "Trump says widespread #coronavirus testing 'would never happen' and isn't needed to reopen country" >> https://t.co/MX1hsslxAd  👀🧐😠 https://t.co/IzIEvcZy0A

@PhillyInquirer: "SEPTA to get $643 million in federal coronavirus relief aid" >> https://t.co/9CEKNsipPB  Thrilled to have secured the funds we need to keep SEPTA operating. Countless Philadelphians rely on public transit -- including essential workers who need it right now. https://t.co/BAvcy6aJ6u

The disproportionate impact of COVID-19 on communities of color is a very scary thing. Congress must address these inequalities in resource availability and distribution before it's too late.   More on this from the @nytimes: https://t.co/bOBbWs4LFj https://t.co/Z1wY6ik30z

I join my House colleagues in demanding the IRS automatically provide COVID-19 payments to the 8 million vulnerable individuals who already rely on Supplemental Security Income (SSI).  READ MORE >> https://t.co/7tzvBmYlcn
Please watch and share with others. #coronavirus #staysafe https://t.co/Wbi59rrEaq
ICYMI: The filing deadline for both federal and Pennsylvania state taxes has been moved to July 15th in light of COVID-19.  READ MORE: https://t.co/h9B6E4GN5B https://t.co/JOWMUAeak2

@BuzzFeedNews: "Donald Trump Won’t Open The #Obamacare Markets During The Coronavirus Outbreak" >> https://t.co/zdmgUlG5iN  This is unacceptable. It's critical we get every American access to the care they need during this pandemic. https://t.co/VCfXekn1rt
ICYMI: @SenatorHaywood and I held a live telephone town hall meeting to address our community's concerns about the COVID-19 pandemic.   Here's some of what you missed: https://t.co/OVMXHHdRPN

Philly Issues Stay-at-Home Order to Stop Coronavirus Spread >> https://t.co/UHWgCDYJZZ  I stand with @PhillyMayor: please Philadelphia stay home.   Lives are at stake here. We must all do our part to keep ourselves AND our communities healthy in the coming weeks. https://t.co/a66tnqnMoX

Countless Philadelphians rely on public transit to get to work and visit loved ones so we must ensure they are still able to do so once the COVID-19 crisis is over.   Read more >> https://t.co/fBiD72MKLC https://t.co/4qkUBpWwG9

Gov. Wolf and Mayors like Jim Kenney and others are doing everything they can to help their constituents but only the federal government can truly marshal all of the necessary resources needed to tackle this health emergency. #COVID19   https://t.co/XhROPa00PP

@CBSPhilly: "Coronavirus In Pennsylvania: All Non-Life-Sustaining Businesses Ordered To Close Physical Locations" >> https://t.co/vWE3m3uyAs   We'll get through this if we work together to prioritize public health & secure much needed aid for small businesses & working families.

@MotherJones: "ICE Is Still Holding Immigrants Vulnerable to Coronavirus. ACLU Just Sued to Let Some Out." >> https://t.co/ItzUTzGLtL  This pandemic affects all of us -- it's critical NO ONE is left behind in our efforts to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/OdP5yO2zaq
Now that the #coronavirus has arrived in Philadelphia it's even more critical we all do our part to help those in need. Learn more here >> https://t.co/jFCSOSvdks https://t.co/v92pmZK3vy

It's critical we support working families and small businesses as the economic impact of the coronavirus is already being felt in communities across America.   Learn more about the House-passed bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act >> https://t.co/uSz0tAy7Jc

@ABC: "Coronavirus and the homeless: Why they're especially at risk ways to stop a spread 'like wildfire'" >> https://t.co/ToCmfFdnQn  We cannot forget to care for the people experiencing homelessness throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/9ZRbrSWXoI

House Democrats Introduce Bill Requiring All Insurance Plans to Cover Full Cost of COVID-19 Testing >> https://t.co/kIrOSY9zlP  #Coronavirus testing needs to be free. Period. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/H9CeufNatk

@Independent: "#Coronavirus: Senate Republicans block emergency sick leave bill as outbreak spreads across US" >> https://t.co/FvwEGyWJ9f   Now is not the time to play politics during an outbreak. People are struggling. Businesses are struggling. We MUST protect the public. https://t.co/PN1vlbJiXL

As we work to make the coronavirus test more widely available we must also work to ensure it's AFFORDABLE.   Fear of big medical bills and the inability to take off work will make it harder for low-income folks to stay healthy.   LEARN MORE >> https://t.co/p14EamvU3p https://t.co/Qan02tZSu4
This week Congress passed an emergency spending bill to help address the #coronavirus threat. Here are some simple steps to keep you and your family safe: https://t.co/4L0Jd1g5mJ

The U.S. coronavirus response should NOT be led by the man who wanted to "pray away" the HIV epidemic. Full stop.  @washingtonpost: "Mike Pence was criticized for his handling of Indiana’s HIV outbreak. He will lead the U.S. coronavirus response." >> https://t.co/QQmLke6xyr https://t.co/qrzLgSKUyM
